devdoc.author: RageTrade*

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Paused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

Unpaused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

claimVestedGmx().details: vested esGmx gets converted to GMX every second, so whatever amount is vested gets claimed

params.shares: asset amount to convert to assets

returns._0: asset amount corresponding to given share amount

params.assets: asset amount to convert to shares

returns._0: share amount corresponding to given asset amount

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

params.amount: amount of sGlp (asset) tokens to deposit

returns.shares: amount of shares allocated for deposit

returns.currentBtcBorrow: amount of btc borrowed from AAVE
returns.currentEthBorrow: amount of eth borrowed from AAVE

getMarketValue(uint256).details: uses minimum price i.e. minimum AUM of glp tokens

returns.marketValue: of given amount of glp assets

params.glpDeposited: amount of glp for which optimal borrow needs to be calculated

returns.optimalBtcBorrow: optimal amount of btc borrowed from AAVE
returns.optimalEthBorrow: optimal amount of eth borrowed from AAVE

params.maximize: specifies aum used is minimum(false) or maximum(true)

returns._0: price of glp token in PRICE_PRECISION
price of glp token in X128

getUsdcBorrowed().details: all aUSDC yield from AAVE goes to the senior vaultdeducts junior vault usdc (swapped + unhedged glp) from overall balance

getVaultMarketValue().details: Part 1. adds value of glp tokens basis minimum glp aum from gmxPart 2. adds value of junior vault usdc deposit in AAVE (swap outputs + unhedged GLP)Part 3. subtracts value of WETH & WBTC borrows from AAVE

grantAllowances().details: to be called once the vault is deployed

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

maxRedeem(address).details: Returns the maximum amount of Vault shares that can be redeemed from the owner balance in the Vault, through a redeem call. - MUST return a limited value if owner is subject to some withdrawal limit or timelock. - MUST return balanceOf(owner) if owner is not subject to any withdrawal limit or timelock. - MUST NOT revert.

maxWithdraw(address).details: Returns the maximum amount of the underlying asset that can be withdrawn from the owner balance in the Vault, through a withdraw call. - MUST return a limited value if owner is subject to some withdrawal limit or timelock. - MUST NOT revert.

params.shares: amount of vault shares to mint

returns.amount: amount of sGlp tokens required for given number of shares

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.assets: number of assets to be deposited

returns._0: shares that would be minted to the user
assets that would be taken from the user

params.shares: that would be taken from the user

params.assets: that would be given to the user

receiveFlashLoan(address[],uint256[],uin.details: only allows balancer vault to call thisonly runs when _hasFlashloaned is set to true (prevents someone else from initiating flashloan to vault)

params.amounts: amounts of token flashloans in same order
params.feeAmounts: amounts of fee/premium charged for flashloan
params.userData: data passed to balancer for flashloan (includes token amounts, token usdc value and swap direction)

params.owner: owner address of the shares to be burnt

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.withdrawFeeBps: fees bps on withdrawals and redeems

params._feeBps: the part of eth rewards earned from GMX earned deducted as protocol fees
params._feeRecipient: recipient address for protocol fees and protocol esGmx

params.aaveRewardsController: AAVE rewards controller for handling additional reward distribution on AAVE
params.swapRouter: uniswap swap router for swapping ETH/BTC to USDC and viceversa
params.targetHealthFactor: health factor to target on AAVE after every rebalance
params.vault: balancer vault for ETH and BTC flashloans

setRebalanceParams(uint32,uint16,uint16).details: a partial rebalance (rebalance where partial hedge gets taken) does not count.setHedgeParams should already have been called.

params.rebalanceDeltaThresholdBps: (BPS) threshold difference between optimal and current token hedges for triggering a rebalance
params.rebalanceHfThresholdBps: (BPS) threshold amount of health factor on AAVE below which a rebalance is triggered
params.rebalanceTimeThreshold: (seconds) minimum time difference required between two rebalance calls

params.hedgeUsdcAmountThreshold: (usdc amount) threshold amount below which ETH/BTC hedges are not executed
params.partialBtcHedgeUsdcAmountThreshold: (usdc amount) threshold amount above which BTC hedge is not fully taken (gets executed in blocks over multiple rebalances)
params.partialEthHedgeUsdcAmountThreshold: (usdc amount) threshold amount above which ETH hedge is not fully taken (gets executed in blocks over multiple rebalances)
params.slippageThresholdGmxBps: (BPS) slippage threshold on sGlp mint and redeem
params.usdcConversionThreshold: (usdc amount) threshold amount for conversion of usdc into sGlp
params.wethConversionThreshold: (weth amount) threshold amount for weth fees to be compounded into sGlp

stopVestAndStakeEsGmx().details: when esGmx is vested some GlP tokens are locked on a pro-rata basis, in case that leads to issue in withdrawal this function can be called

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalAssets().details: some unhedged part of glp might be converted to USDC (its value in GLP is added to total glp assets)

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.owner: owner address of the shares to be burnt

devdoc.title: Delta Neutral GMX Junior Tranche contract

claimVestedGmx().notice: claims vested gmx tokens to feeRecipient

convertToAssets(uint256).notice: converts share amount to asset amount

convertToShares(uint256).notice: converts asset amount to share amount

deposit(uint256,address).notice: deposits sGlp token and returns vault shares

depositCap().notice: returns deposit cap in terms of asset tokens

dnUsdcDeposited().notice: returns junior vault share of usdc deposited to AAVE

getCurrentBorrows().notice: returns current borrows for BTC and ETH respectively

getMarketValue(uint256).notice: returns the minimum market value of "assetAmount" of asset (sGlp) tokens

getOptimalBorrows(uint256,bool).notice: returns optimal borrows for BTC and ETH respectively basis glpDeposited amount

getUsdcBorrowed().notice: returns total amount of usdc borrowed from senior vault

getVaultMarketValue().notice: returns vault market value (USD terms & 6 decimals) basis glp and usdc tokens in vault

grantAllowances().notice: grants allowances for tokens to relevant external contracts

isValidRebalance().notice: checks if the rebalance can be run (3 thresholds - time, hedge deviation and AAVE HF )

maxDeposit(address).notice: returns maximum amount of shares that a user can deposit

maxMint(address).notice: returns maximum amount of shares that can be minted for a given user

mint(uint256,address).notice: mints "shares" amount of vault shares and pull relevant amount of sGlp tokens

pause().notice: pause deposit, mint, withdraw and redeem

previewDeposit(uint256).notice: preview function for using assets to mint shares

previewMint(uint256).notice: preview function for minting of shares

previewWithdraw(uint256).notice: preview function for withdrawal of assets

rebalance().notice: harvests glp rewards & rebalances the hedge positions, profits on AAVE and Gmx.run only if valid rebalance is true

receiveFlashLoan(address[],uint256[],uin.notice: flashloan receiver for balance vaultreceives flashloaned tokens(WETH or WBTC or USDC) from balancer, swaps on uniswap and borrows/repays on AAVE

redeem(uint256,address,address).notice: burns "shares" amount of vault shares and withdraws relevant amount of sGlp tokensdeducts some assets for the remaining shareholders to cover the cost of opening and closing of hedge

stopVestAndStakeEsGmx().notice: claims vested gmx tokens (i.e. stops vesting esGmx so that the relevant glp amount is unlocked)

totalAssets().notice: gives total asset tokens available in vault

unpause().notice: unpause deposit, mint, withdraw and redeem

unstakeAndVestEsGmx().notice: unstakes and vest protocol esGmx to convert it to Gmx

withdraw(uint256,address,address).notice: withdraws "assets" amount of sGlp tokens and burns relevant amount of vault sharesdeducts some assets for the remaining shareholders to cover the cost of opening and closing of hedge

userdoc.notice: Implements the handling of junior tranche which maintains hedges for btc and eth basis the target weights on GMXIt is upgradable contract (via TransparentUpgradeableProxy proxy owned by ProxyAdmin)
